Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is black in section, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with self-slip and remains of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393343) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393343)
